comment.author: 37244380@N00
comment._content: Interesting series.  What was being promoted in this one?  Telegraph / Telegram? - I see wires hung inside the booth.

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content:
I think it's a post-marking machine. From the extended notes on the image in our files:

"A stall at a trade fair probably held in Auckland, advertising and displaying a machine for postal service "Neopost, a post office on your own premises". The sign reads "Neopost, the best British meter mailing machine", and there is a large poster showing a sample which reads "Neopost, Campbell Buildings, High Street, Auckland" and is dated 9 Jul 1930, 1d postage. Other signs read "A turn of the handle stamps postmarks, and prints a slogan", and "The machine that stamps, cancels and advertises in one revolution"."

Personally, I love the Wendy House aesthetic; I'd love to have one of these little booths instead of my cubicle at work!

-- Courtney
comment.authorname: National Library NZ on The Commons

comment.author: 37244380@N00
comment._content: Courtney - Sorry, silly of me to not look in 'more about this image'.  Thanks.
